net.sf.JRecord.utilityClasses

Class Copy

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.JRecord.utilityClasses.Copy

  • public class Copy
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a Class containing static methods to read a file using a Schema and write the data contents out with a different Schema. It could be used to copy Cobol data files to Csv or Csv files to Cobol etc.

    At the moment (19-Oct-2014) this should be considered a Test module; so use it with Caution

    Author:
    Bruce Martin

    • Method Detail

      • copyFileByMatchingFieldNames

        public static void copyFileByMatchingFieldNames(LayoutDetail inSchema,
                                java.lang.String inFileName,
                                LayoutDetail outSchema,
                                java.lang.String outFileName)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        This method copies an input file to an output file record by record. The fields on the input record are copies to the output record by matching the field names. 
         i.e.
    outputLine.field("Field-Name") = inputline.field("Field-Name")

        At the moment (19-Oct-2014) this should be considered a Test module; so use it with Caution

        Parameters:
        inSchema - input schema (layout or file description)
        inFileName - input filename
        outSchema - output schema (layout or file description)
        outFileName - output filename
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Any IO error

      • copyFileByMatchingFieldNames

                               AbstractLine outLine)
                                        throws java.io.IOException

      • copyFileByMatchingFieldNames

        public static int copyFileByMatchingFieldNames(AbstractLineReader reader,
                               AbstractLineWriter writer,
                               LayoutDetail outSchema)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        This method copies an input file to an output file record by record. The fields on the input record are copies to the output record by matching the field names. 
         i.e.
    outputLine.field("Field-Name") = inputline.field("Field-Name")

        At the moment (19-Oct-2014) this should be considered a Test module; so use it with Caution

        Parameters:
        reader - input reader source of input lines (or records)
        writer - output writer
        outLine - output line used to write to the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - any IO exception that occurs

      • copyFileByFieldNumber

        public static void copyFileByFieldNumber(LayoutDetail inSchema,
                         java.lang.String inFileName,
                         LayoutDetail outSchema,
                         java.lang.String outFileName)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method copies an input file to an output file record by record. The fields on the input record are copies to the output record by field number 
         i.e.
    outputLine.field(i) = inputline.field(i)

        At the moment (19-Oct-2014) this should be considered a Test module; so use it with Caution

        Parameters:
        inSchema - input schema (layout or file description)
        inFileName - input filename
        outSchema - output schema (layout or file description)
        outFileName - output filename
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Any IO error

      • copyFileByFieldNumber

        public static int copyFileByFieldNumber(AbstractLineReader reader,
                        AbstractLineWriter writer,
                        LayoutDetail outSchema)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        copy the file (move the field number i in the input record to field number i in the output record) 
         i.e.
    outputLine.field(i) = inputline.field(i)
        Parameters:
        reader - input reader source of input lines (or records)
        writer - output writer
        outLine - output line used to write to the file
        Returns:
        number of records copied
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        RecordException

      • doCopy

        public static int doCopy(AbstractLineReader reader,
         AbstractLineWriter writer,
         java.util.List<FieldDetail> fieldMapping,
         INewLineCreator lineCreator)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Do the actual file copy
        Parameters:
        reader - file reader to read the data from
        writer - file writer to write the output data
        fieldMapping - mapping between input record and output record
        inLine - input line
        outLine - output line that will be writtent to the file
        Returns:
        number of records written
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - any IO error (on the close)
